de.mixedfx.network

Class NetworkManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mixedfx.network.NetworkManager

  • public class NetworkManager
extends java.lang.Object

    Builds up a network. You can receive or send (a child of) RegisteredMessage via MessageBus. Connection to a host server or someone who is connected to the host server will be established automatically.
    To get an information about the network status or if you want to host get online or set it manually to NetworkManager.OnlineStates.Established or NetworkManager.OnlineStates.Offline
    ParticipantManager.PARTICIPANTS shows at any time all connected and registered participants (including this application) if online. ParticipantManager.MY_PID is the applications participant id (hosts id is 1) if online, otherwise it is 0
    If an error occur only a NETWORK_FATALERROR is sent over the EventBus[Extended].
    If you may want to set the port use setPort(int) (after setting the port the entire network is restarted). (Usually only necessary if there was an fatal error!)

    • Field Detail

      • NETWORK_FATALERROR

        public static final java.lang.String NETWORK_FATALERROR
        Register for this event over EventBusExtended or EventBus if you want to be informed that there was a network error which closed the entire network. Not recommended: You may call again init() to initialize the network. Further information: This error does relate to the UDP Server in most cases (not if NetworkConfig.status = NetworkConfig.States.Server). The cause probably is the port. React to that port error with setPort(int) with the recommendation to choose a random number between 10 000 and 60 000!
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • online

        public static javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<NetworkManager.OnlineStates> online
        Represents the status, bidirectional binding (setting) is possible!

        If triggered internally:
        See description of NetworkManager.OnlineStates.Online, NetworkManager.OnlineStates.Established and NetworkManager.OnlineStates.Offline!

        If triggered from you:
        NetworkManager.OnlineStates.Established means you are the NetworkConfig.States.Server. Others can now connect (automatically).
        Set NetworkManager.OnlineStates.Offline means the connection will be interrupted.
        ATTENTION: Do NOT set NetworkManager.OnlineStates.Online (it is read-only)!

      • t

        protected static TCPCoordinator t

        protected static de.mixedfx.network.UDPCoordinator u

        public NetworkManager()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()

        Initializes UDP and TCP connection. Start listening and broadcasting on UDP connection and automatically sets up a TCP connection if NetworkConfig.States.BoundToServer or if NetworkConfig.States.Server application was found. Use MessageBus to deal with Message! Use online [reading] to listen to the NetworkStatus. (this method init() should be called after register a listener to online status).

      • setPort

        public static void setPort(int portNumber)

        Sets the default port for UDP and TCP. After this it shuts down the complete network and calls init() again. Default port is NetworkConfig.PORT. This port is mostly necessary for the UDP Server. In case of TCP the port + 1 (to 5) is asked if port is not available.

      • getPort

        public static int getPort()
        Returns:
        Returns the current port.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
